intro: Heteropterys campestris, commonly known as the field hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in yellow or orange. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in open fields and along riverbanks.
